page.title: 05Churches in Pevensey area.
page.content: {St.Mary's C.E.Westham}Rev.Albert Ginno first church built by Normans,1080. Annual centre for local flower festival.From church tower excellent views of annual nesting of herons in yew trees in the adjacent school playground.An actiue church locally. {St.Nicholas'C.E.Pevensey}seal of Pevensey has St.Nicholas in a boat in Pevensey Bay.Patron saint of sailors and children.Local names on grave- stones.Square font is all that remains of original Norman church.Satellite church,{St.Wilfrid's in Pevensey Bay. Church and hall used daily by local groups:half_owned and rates paid by Parish Council.{Holy Rood R.C. {satellite to Christ the King,Langney. Has one mass each Sunday.{Pevensey Bay {Free Church,}just built to replace a pre_fabricated building, 2 storeys with church hall upstairs.
